intro: Scleria gracillima, commonly known as the slender spike-rush, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant features grass-like leaves and produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. It typically grows in moist, sandy soils along riverbanks and in wetlands. Scleria gracillima is characterized by its delicate appearance and is often found in open, sunny habitats.
